meanings.definition: The position or role of a custodian.
meanings.sent1: In her custodianship, she ensures the school is clean and safe.
meanings.sent2: His custodianship of the keys allows him to access all the rooms.
meanings.sent3: The custodianship of the lost toys was a big task for the kind teacher.
meanings.sent4: She held the custodianship of the ancient artifact with great reverence.
meanings.sent5: The custodianship of the garden involved daily watering and weeding.

meanings.definition: The responsibility or duty of taking care of something.
meanings.sent1: The custodianship of the fragile vase was entrusted to him.
meanings.sent2: She took her custodianship of the family pet very seriously.
meanings.sent3: His custodianship of the cookies meant they were safe from his own sweet tooth.
meanings.sent4: The custodianship of the secret recipe was passed down through generations.
meanings.sent5: The custodianship of the forest involved protecting it from harm.
